children.name: Engine
README

BluePrints Pipeline Summary Here's how the app transforms FigJam diagrams into interactive flow charts: 1. FigJam Extraction (npm run extract:figma) Script: scripts/figma-extract.mjs Extracts raw data from a FigJam JSON export: Walks the document tree recursively Captures TEXT and STICKY nodes with their IDs, text, sections, and colors Outputs output/extracted/<fileKey>_extracted.json 2. Card Grammar Parsing (npm run flow:gen) Scripts: scripts/blueprints/generateFlowFromExtract.mjs + scripts/blueprints/parseCards.mjs Parses a DSL (Domain Specific Language) using prefix labels: PrefixPurposeG:Goal - Business/user objectivesP:Persona - User type definitionsA:Actor - Lane/swimlane declarationF: / FLOW:Flow Group - Named scenario/journeyS:Step - User actionSYS:System Step - Automatic system behaviorD:Decision - Yes/No branching pointE:Edge - Explicit connection (from → to)START:Entry pointEND:Successful completionEXIT:Early exit/error pathAC:Acceptance CriteriaQ:Open QuestionsRISK:Potential issues Output: FlowSpec JSON with structured arrays for personas, goals, steps, decisions, edges, etc. 3. FlowGraph Expansion - SpecKit Engine (npm run flow:expand) Scripts: scripts/blueprints/generateFlowGraph.mjs + scripts/blueprints/expandFlowGraph.mjs This is the intelligent inference layer that transforms FlowSpec into a complete FlowGraph: A. Lane Determination Collects declared actors (A: entries) Infers lanes from persona names Always includes System lane B. Entry/Exit Point Detection If explicit START: nodes exist → uses those Otherwise detects mode patterns (Solo/With Friends) and generates appropriate starts Creates END_SUCCESS, END_EXIT, and optionally END_ERROR nodes C. System Step Inference Pattern-matches content to automatically add system steps: { pattern: /permission|microphone|camera/, label: 'Request Permission' } { pattern: /lobby|room|session/, label: 'Create Session' } { pattern: /sync|synchronize|real-?time/, label: 'Sync State' } { pattern: /save|persist|store/, label: 'Save Data' } // etc.  D. Intelligent Edge Generation (The Core Algorithm) Principle: "Every node must be connected, forming a coherent flow" START → First Step: Connects each start node to first action in its lane Sequential Steps: Steps within same lane connect in document order Decision Branching (semantic-aware): Analyzes decision text to classify type (permission, availability, validity, readiness) Yes branch: Routes to next logical step No branch: Uses intelligent matching to find appropriate exit: Permission denied → finds "listen-only" or limited mode Unavailable → finds error/unavailable exit Final Step → End: Unconnected steps route to appropriate end node Cycle Prevention: DFS ensures no backwards edges E. Explicit vs. Inferred If E: edges are defined → uses those + fills minimal gaps If no edges → auto-generates all edges intelligently Marks inferred nodes with inferred: true flag 4. Web Rendering (FlowViewer.tsx) Uses React Flow to display the FlowGraph: BFS Layout: Computes node "levels" from start nodes, positions left-to-right Row Wrapping: Wraps to new rows every 4 levels Swimlanes: Color-coded by actor (User, Host, Guest, System) Custom Nodes: Different shapes for steps, decisions, start/end Interactive: Pan, zoom, MiniMap, edit nodes/edges Data Flow Diagram FigJam (Visual)  │ Export JSON  ▼ ┌─────────────────────┐ │ figma-extract.mjs │ → _extracted.json (raw text nodes) └─────────┬───────────┘  │ Parse DSL (G:, S:, D:, etc.)  ▼ ┌─────────────────────┐ │ parseCards.mjs │ → flowspec.json (structured data) └─────────┬───────────┘  │ SpecKit Expansion  ▼ ┌─────────────────────┐ │ expandFlowGraph.mjs │ → flowgraph.json (complete graph) │ • Infer lanes │ │ • Infer start/end │ │ • Infer system steps│ │ • Generate edges │ └─────────┬───────────┘  │  ▼ ┌─────────────────────┐ │ FlowViewer.tsx │ → Interactive Diagram │ (React Flow) │ └─────────────────────┘  Key Innovation: SpecKit The power of BluePrints is that designers can write high-level sticky notes in FigJam like: S: User taps "Karaoke" D: Is karaoke available? END: Session started EXIT: Karaoke unavailable  And SpecKit automatically infers: A START node connects to the first step The decision's Yes branch goes to session start The decision's No branch goes to the unavailable exit (semantic matching) System steps for data fetching are added if needed This lets designers focus on the story while the system handles technical flow details.
children.characters:
BluePrints Pipeline Summary

Here's how the app transforms FigJam diagrams into interactive flow charts:

1. FigJam Extraction (npm run extract:figma)

Script: scripts/figma-extract.mjs
Extracts raw data from a FigJam JSON export:
Walks the document tree recursively
Captures TEXT and STICKY nodes with their IDs, text, sections, and colors
Outputs output/extracted/<fileKey>_extracted.json

2. Card Grammar Parsing (npm run flow:gen)
Scripts: scripts/blueprints/generateFlowFromExtract.mjs + scripts/blueprints/parseCards.mjs
Parses a DSL (Domain Specific Language) using prefix labels:
PrefixPurposeG:Goal - Business/user objectivesP:Persona - User type definitionsA:Actor - Lane/swimlane declarationF: / FLOW:Flow Group - Named scenario/journeyS:Step - User actionSYS:System Step - Automatic system behaviorD:Decision - Yes/No branching pointE:Edge - Explicit connection (from → to)START:Entry pointEND:Successful completionEXIT:Early exit/error pathAC:Acceptance CriteriaQ:Open QuestionsRISK:Potential issues
Output: FlowSpec JSON with structured arrays for personas, goals, steps, decisions, edges, etc.

3. FlowGraph Expansion - SpecKit Engine (npm run flow:expand)

Scripts: scripts/blueprints/generateFlowGraph.mjs + scripts/blueprints/expandFlowGraph.mjs
This is the intelligent inference layer that transforms FlowSpec into a complete FlowGraph:
A. Lane Determination
Collects declared actors (A: entries)
Infers lanes from persona names
Always includes System lane
B. Entry/Exit Point Detection
If explicit START: nodes exist → uses those
Otherwise detects mode patterns (Solo/With Friends) and generates appropriate starts
Creates END_SUCCESS, END_EXIT, and optionally END_ERROR nodes
C. System Step Inference
Pattern-matches content to automatically add system steps:
{ pattern: /permission|microphone|camera/, label: 'Request Permission' } { pattern: /lobby|room|session/, label: 'Create Session' } { pattern: /sync|synchronize|real-?time/, label: 'Sync State' } { pattern: /save|persist|store/, label: 'Save Data' } // etc. 
D. Intelligent Edge Generation (The Core Algorithm)
Principle: "Every node must be connected, forming a coherent flow"
START → First Step: Connects each start node to first action in its lane
Sequential Steps: Steps within same lane connect in document order
Decision Branching (semantic-aware):
Analyzes decision text to classify type (permission, availability, validity, readiness)
Yes branch: Routes to next logical step
No branch: Uses intelligent matching to find appropriate exit:
Permission denied → finds "listen-only" or limited mode
Unavailable → finds error/unavailable exit
Final Step → End: Unconnected steps route to appropriate end node
Cycle Prevention: DFS ensures no backwards edges
E. Explicit vs. Inferred
If E: edges are defined → uses those + fills minimal gaps
If no edges → auto-generates all edges intelligently
Marks inferred nodes with inferred: true flag
4. Web Rendering (FlowViewer.tsx)
Uses React Flow to display the FlowGraph:
BFS Layout: Computes node "levels" from start nodes, positions left-to-right
Row Wrapping: Wraps to new rows every 4 levels
Swimlanes: Color-coded by actor (User, Host, Guest, System)
Custom Nodes: Different shapes for steps, decisions, start/end
Interactive: Pan, zoom, MiniMap, edit nodes/edges
Data Flow Diagram
FigJam (Visual)       │ Export JSON       ▼ ┌─────────────────────┐ │ figma-extract.mjs   │  → _extracted.json (raw text nodes) └─────────┬───────────┘           │ Parse DSL (G:, S:, D:, etc.)           ▼ ┌─────────────────────┐ │ parseCards.mjs      │  → flowspec.json (structured data) └─────────┬───────────┘           │ SpecKit Expansion           ▼ ┌─────────────────────┐ │ expandFlowGraph.mjs │  → flowgraph.json (complete graph) │ • Infer lanes       │ │ • Infer start/end   │ │ • Infer system steps│ │ • Generate edges    │ └─────────┬───────────┘           │           ▼ ┌─────────────────────┐ │ FlowViewer.tsx      │  → Interactive Diagram │ (React Flow)        │ └─────────────────────┘ 
Key Innovation: SpecKit
The power of BluePrints is that designers can write high-level sticky notes in FigJam like:
S: User taps "Karaoke" D: Is karaoke available? END: Session started EXIT: Karaoke unavailable 
And SpecKit automatically infers:
A START node connects to the first step
The decision's Yes branch goes to session start
The decision's No branch goes to the unavailable exit (semantic matching)
System steps for data fetching are added if needed
This lets designers focus on the story while the system handles technical flow details.

children.name: Generic Components (100% portable) 1. Extraction (figma-extract.mjs) Extracts TEXT/STICKY nodes from any FigJam file No project-specific code 2. Card Grammar Parsing (parseCards.mjs) Completely generic DSL parser Recognizes all prefixes: G:, S:, D:, F:, E:, START:, END:, EXIT:, etc. No domain-specific code Mostly Generic with Fallbacks 3. FlowGraph Expansion (expandFlowGraph.mjs) Has a few Spotify-specific fallback patterns that won't break other projects: CodePurposeFallback if not matched'karaoke' keyword (line 270, 357)Match "karaoke unavailable" exitsUses generic exit matching'solo' / 'with friends' (lines 529-531)Detect multi-mode entry pointsSingle START node'listener' persona (line 169)Map to User laneUses 'User' lane'host' / 'guest' keywordsSession-style swimlanesUses 'User' + 'System' lanes What Happens with Different Content If you change the FigJam content to another project (e.g., an e-commerce checkout flow): Extraction - Works identically Parsing - Works identically (as long as you use the DSL prefixes) Expansion: Won't detect "solo/friends" modes → creates single START node ✓ Won't match "karaoke" → uses generic exit matching ✓ Will use lanes you declare with A: or infer from P: personas ✓ System step inference still works (auth, save, load, validate, etc.) ✓ Recommendation The pipeline is project-agnostic by design. Just ensure your FigJam content uses the Card Grammar: G: Allow users to checkout their cart P: Shopper - wants to purchase items quickly F: Standard Checkout S: User reviews cart items S: User enters shipping address D: Is address valid? SYS: Validate address with API END: Order confirmed EXIT: Invalid address  The Spotify-specific code only provides enhanced intelligence for that domain - it won't cause errors for other projects.
children.characters:
Generic Components (100% portable)

1. Extraction (figma-extract.mjs)
Extracts TEXT/STICKY nodes from any FigJam file
No project-specific code
2. Card Grammar Parsing (parseCards.mjs)
Completely generic DSL parser
Recognizes all prefixes: G:, S:, D:, F:, E:, START:, END:, EXIT:, etc.
No domain-specific code
Mostly Generic with Fallbacks

3. FlowGraph Expansion (expandFlowGraph.mjs)

Has a few Spotify-specific fallback patterns that won't break other projects:
CodePurposeFallback if not matched'karaoke' keyword (line 270, 357)Match "karaoke unavailable" exitsUses generic exit matching'solo' / 'with friends' (lines 529-531)Detect multi-mode entry pointsSingle START node'listener' persona (line 169)Map to User laneUses 'User' lane'host' / 'guest' keywordsSession-style swimlanesUses 'User' + 'System' lanes

What Happens with Different Content
If you change the FigJam content to another project (e.g., an e-commerce checkout flow):

Extraction - Works identically
Parsing - Works identically (as long as you use the DSL prefixes)
Expansion:
Won't detect "solo/friends" modes → creates single START node ✓
Won't match "karaoke" → uses generic exit matching ✓
Will use lanes you declare with A: or infer from P: personas ✓
System step inference still works (auth, save, load, validate, etc.) ✓
Recommendation


The pipeline is project-agnostic by design. Just ensure your FigJam content uses the Card Grammar:

G: Allow users to checkout their cart P: Shopper - wants to purchase items quickly F: Standard Checkout S: User reviews cart items S: User enters shipping address D: Is address valid? SYS: Validate address with API END: Order confirmed EXIT: Invalid address 
The Spotify-specific code only provides enhanced intelligence for that domain - it won't cause errors for other projects.

children.name: BLUEPRINTS ENGINE - PROJECT INPUT
PERSONAS
P: Casual Listener - wants a low-pressure, no-judgment karaoke experience
children.characters: P: Casual Listener - wants a low-pressure, no-judgment karaoke experience

children.name: P: Karaoke Host - wants to start a session fast and invite friends easily
children.characters: P: Karaoke Host - wants to start a session fast and invite friends easily

children.name: P: Friend Participant - wants to join instantly and understand what to do next
children.characters: P: Friend Participant - wants to join instantly and understand what to do next

children.name: P: Competitive Singer - wants scoring and performance feedback (optional)
children.characters: P: Competitive Singer - wants scoring and performance feedback (optional)

children.name: P: Social Sharer - wants results or clips to share after a session
children.characters: P: Social Sharer - wants results or clips to share after a session

children.name: P: Privacy-Conscious User - wants control over mic usage and recording
children.characters: P: Privacy-Conscious User - wants control over mic usage and recording

children.name: GOALS
G: Let users sing along with synchronized lyrics for any supported song
children.characters: G: Let users sing along with synchronized lyrics for any supported song

children.name: G: Support both Solo Karaoke and With Friends Karaoke
children.characters: G: Support both Solo Karaoke and With Friends Karaoke

children.name: G: Minimize time-to-first-lyric (fast entry from a song page)
children.characters: G: Minimize time-to-first-lyric (fast entry from a song page)

children.name: G: Make joining a friend session effortless via link
children.characters: G: Make joining a friend session effortless via link

children.name: G: Provide a delightful “session” feeling (lobby, ready states, shared experience)
children.characters: G: Provide a delightful “session” feeling (lobby, ready states, shared experience)

children.name: G: Keep the feature safe, respectful, and privacy-first
children.characters: G: Keep the feature safe, respectful, and privacy-first

children.name: REQUIREMENTS
R: Karaoke mode must display real-time synchronized lyrics with highlighting
children.characters: R: Karaoke mode must display real-time synchronized lyrics with highlighting

children.name: R: Karaoke mode must support Solo mode
children.characters: R: Karaoke mode must support Solo mode

children.name: R: Karaoke mode must support With Friends mode (real-time session)
children.characters: R: Karaoke mode must support With Friends mode (real-time session)

children.name: R: Host can create a karaoke session from a song
children.characters: R: Host can create a karaoke session from a song

children.name: R: Host can invite friends using a shareable link
children.characters: R: Host can invite friends using a shareable link

children.name: R: Participant can join session from invite link
children.characters: R: Participant can join session from invite link

children.name: R: Lobby must show who joined and who is ready
children.characters: R: Lobby must show who joined and who is ready

children.name: R: Session must have a clear Start action controlled by the host
children.characters: R: Session must have a clear Start action controlled by the host

children.name: R: Users can mute/unmute themselves during the session
children.characters: R: Users can mute/unmute themselves during the session

children.name: R: Users can leave session at any time without breaking the session
children.characters: R: Users can leave session at any time without breaking the session

children.name: R: App must request microphone permission only when needed and explain why
children.characters: R: App must request microphone permission only when needed and explain why

children.name: R: Karaoke should be usable even if mic permission is denied (lyrics-only mode)
children.characters: R: Karaoke should be usable even if mic permission is denied (lyrics-only mode)

children.name: R: App must handle network latency gracefully (allow slight desync + reconnection)
children.characters: R: App must handle network latency gracefully (allow slight desync + reconnection)

children.name: R: App must show clear feedback for loading, syncing, and connection issues
children.characters: R: App must show clear feedback for loading, syncing, and connection issues

children.name: R: Competitive scoring mode is optional and can be enabled per session
children.characters: R: Competitive scoring mode is optional and can be enabled per session

children.characters: S: User taps a new action called “Karaoke”

children.characters: S: If Solo, user starts immediately and sees lyrics sync with playback

children.name: FLOW : SOLO KARAOKE

F: Solo Karaoke A: User START: User initiates Solo Karaoke from a song S: (S1) User opens a song detail page S: (S2) User taps “Karaoke” SYS: Evaluate Karaoke availability for the song D: Is Karaoke supported for this song? E: D1 -> S3 [label=Yes] E: D1 -> END_EXIT [label=No] S: (S3) User selects Solo Karaoke mode SYS: Request microphone permission (just-in-time) D: Is microphone permission granted? E: D2 -> S4 [label=Yes] E: D2 -> S5 [label=No] S: (S4) Start Solo Karaoke with live lyrics + mic input S: (S5) Start Solo Karaoke in lyrics-only mode END: Solo Karaoke session completed END: User exits Solo Karaoke early
children.characters:
F: Solo Karaoke
A: User

START: User initiates Solo Karaoke from a song

S: (S1) User opens a song detail page
S: (S2) User taps “Karaoke”
SYS: Evaluate Karaoke availability for the song

D: Is Karaoke supported for this song?
E: D1 -> S3 [label=Yes]
E: D1 -> END_EXIT [label=No]

S: (S3) User selects Solo Karaoke mode
SYS: Request microphone permission (just-in-time)

D: Is microphone permission granted?
E: D2 -> S4 [label=Yes]
E: D2 -> S5 [label=No]

S: (S4) Start Solo Karaoke with live lyrics + mic input
S: (S5) Start Solo Karaoke in lyrics-only mode

END: Solo Karaoke session completed
END: User exits Solo Karaoke early

children.name: FLOW: HOST WITH FRIENDS

F: Host With Friends A: Host START: Host initiates Karaoke with Friends from a song S: (H1) Host taps “Karaoke” S: (H2) Host selects “With Friends” SYS: Create karaoke session and lobby SYS: Request microphone permission (just-in-time) D: Is microphone permission granted? E: D3 -> H3 [label=Yes] E: D3 -> H4 [label=No] S: (H3) Host enters lobby with mic enabled S: (H4) Host enters lobby in lyrics-only mode S: (H5) Host shares invite link SYS: Generate invite link D: How does host invite friends? E: D4 -> H6 [label=Share Sheet] E: D4 -> H7 [label=Copy Link] S: (H8) Host waits in lobby SYS: Display joined participants and readiness state D: Are participants ready? E: D5 -> H9 [label=Yes] E: D5 -> H8 [label=No] S: (H9) Host starts Karaoke session SYS: Sync lyrics and playback for all participants END: Group Karaoke session completed END: Host leaves or ends session
children.characters:
F: Host With Friends
A: Host

START: Host initiates Karaoke with Friends from a song

S: (H1) Host taps “Karaoke”
S: (H2) Host selects “With Friends”
SYS: Create karaoke session and lobby

SYS: Request microphone permission (just-in-time)

D: Is microphone permission granted?
E: D3 -> H3 [label=Yes]
E: D3 -> H4 [label=No]

S: (H3) Host enters lobby with mic enabled
S: (H4) Host enters lobby in lyrics-only mode

S: (H5) Host shares invite link
SYS: Generate invite link

D: How does host invite friends?
E: D4 -> H6 [label=Share Sheet]
E: D4 -> H7 [label=Copy Link]

S: (H8) Host waits in lobby
SYS: Display joined participants and readiness state

D: Are participants ready?
E: D5 -> H9 [label=Yes]
E: D5 -> H8 [label=No]

S: (H9) Host starts Karaoke session
SYS: Sync lyrics and playback for all participants

END: Group Karaoke session completed
END: Host leaves or ends session

children.name: FLOW: JOIN VIA INVITE LINK

F: Join via Invite Link A: Guest START: Guest opens Karaoke invite link SYS: Validate invite link D: Is invite link valid? E: D6 -> G1 [label=Yes] E: D6 -> END_ERROR [label=No] S: (G1) Guest joins lobby SYS: Display song, participants, and session status SYS: Request microphone permission (just-in-time) D: Is microphone permission granted? E: D7 -> G2 [label=Yes] E: D7 -> G3 [label=No] S: (G2) Guest joins with mic enabled S: (G3) Guest joins in lyrics-only mode D: Has host started the session? E: D8 -> G4 [label=Yes] E: D8 -> G1 [label=No] S: (G4) Participate in karaoke session END: Guest leaves session END: Session ends
children.characters:
F: Join via Invite Link
A: Guest

START: Guest opens Karaoke invite link

SYS: Validate invite link

D: Is invite link valid?
E: D6 -> G1 [label=Yes]
E: D6 -> END_ERROR [label=No]

S: (G1) Guest joins lobby
SYS: Display song, participants, and session status

SYS: Request microphone permission (just-in-time)

D: Is microphone permission granted?
E: D7 -> G2 [label=Yes]
E: D7 -> G3 [label=No]

S: (G2) Guest joins with mic enabled
S: (G3) Guest joins in lyrics-only mode

D: Has host started the session?
E: D8 -> G4 [label=Yes]
E: D8 -> G1 [label=No]

S: (G4) Participate in karaoke session

END: Guest leaves session
END: Session ends

children.name: CONTEXT

CTX: Project = Spotify Karaoke CTX: Client = Spotify CTX: OutputSlug = spotify_karaoke CTX: Version = v1 CTX: Platform = Mobile (iOS, Android) CTX: Owner = Blue G: Enable users to sing along to songs solo or with friends G: Provide a fast, low-friction entry into karaoke from a song G: Preserve privacy and consent around microphone use G: Support imperfect networks with graceful degradation

children.name: Schema
BLUEPRINTS ENGINE - PROJECT INPUT

BLUEPRINTS ENGINE - PROJECT INPUT
PERSONAS
P: Casual Listener - wants a low-pressure, no-judgment karaoke experience
children.characters: P: Casual Listener - wants a low-pressure, no-judgment karaoke experience

children.name: P: Karaoke Host - wants to start a session fast and invite friends easily
children.characters: P: Karaoke Host - wants to start a session fast and invite friends easily

children.name: P: Friend Participant - wants to join instantly and understand what to do next
children.characters: P: Friend Participant - wants to join instantly and understand what to do next

children.name: P: Competitive Singer - wants scoring and performance feedback (optional)
children.characters: P: Competitive Singer - wants scoring and performance feedback (optional)

children.name: P: Social Sharer - wants results or clips to share after a session
children.characters: P: Social Sharer - wants results or clips to share after a session

children.name: P: Privacy-Conscious User - wants control over mic usage and recording
children.characters: P: Privacy-Conscious User - wants control over mic usage and recording

children.name: GOALS
G: Let users sing along with synchronized lyrics for any supported song
children.characters: G: Let users sing along with synchronized lyrics for any supported song

children.name: G: Support both Solo Karaoke and With Friends Karaoke
children.characters: G: Support both Solo Karaoke and With Friends Karaoke

children.name: G: Minimize time-to-first-lyric (fast entry from a song page)
children.characters: G: Minimize time-to-first-lyric (fast entry from a song page)

children.name: G: Make joining a friend session effortless via link
children.characters: G: Make joining a friend session effortless via link

children.name: G: Provide a delightful “session” feeling (lobby, ready states, shared experience)
children.characters: G: Provide a delightful “session” feeling (lobby, ready states, shared experience)

children.name: G: Keep the feature safe, respectful, and privacy-first
children.characters: G: Keep the feature safe, respectful, and privacy-first

children.name: REQUIREMENTS
R: Karaoke mode must display real-time synchronized lyrics with highlighting
children.characters: R: Karaoke mode must display real-time synchronized lyrics with highlighting

children.name: R: Karaoke mode must support Solo mode
children.characters: R: Karaoke mode must support Solo mode

children.name: R: Karaoke mode must support With Friends mode (real-time session)
children.characters: R: Karaoke mode must support With Friends mode (real-time session)

children.name: R: Host can create a karaoke session from a song
children.characters: R: Host can create a karaoke session from a song

children.name: R: Host can invite friends using a shareable link
children.characters: R: Host can invite friends using a shareable link

children.name: R: Participant can join session from invite link
children.characters: R: Participant can join session from invite link

children.name: R: Lobby must show who joined and who is ready
children.characters: R: Lobby must show who joined and who is ready

children.name: R: Session must have a clear Start action controlled by the host
children.characters: R: Session must have a clear Start action controlled by the host

children.name: R: Users can mute/unmute themselves during the session
children.characters: R: Users can mute/unmute themselves during the session

children.name: R: Users can leave session at any time without breaking the session
children.characters: R: Users can leave session at any time without breaking the session

children.name: R: App must request microphone permission only when needed and explain why
children.characters: R: App must request microphone permission only when needed and explain why

children.name: R: Karaoke should be usable even if mic permission is denied (lyrics-only mode)
children.characters: R: Karaoke should be usable even if mic permission is denied (lyrics-only mode)

children.name: R: App must handle network latency gracefully (allow slight desync + reconnection)
children.characters: R: App must handle network latency gracefully (allow slight desync + reconnection)

children.name: R: App must show clear feedback for loading, syncing, and connection issues
children.characters: R: App must show clear feedback for loading, syncing, and connection issues

children.name: R: Competitive scoring mode is optional and can be enabled per session
children.characters: R: Competitive scoring mode is optional and can be enabled per session

children.name: USER FLOW NOTES
S: User opens a song detail page
children.characters: S: User opens a song detail page

children.name: S: User taps a new action called “Karaoke”
children.characters: S: User taps a new action called “Karaoke”

children.name: S: App shows Karaoke setup screen with mode selection (Solo / With Friends)
children.characters: S: App shows Karaoke setup screen with mode selection (Solo / With Friends)

children.name: S: If Solo, user starts immediately and sees lyrics sync with playback
children.characters: S: If Solo, user starts immediately and sees lyrics sync with playback

children.name: S: If With Friends, user becomes Host and a lobby is created
children.characters: S: If With Friends, user becomes Host and a lobby is created

children.name: S: Lobby shows session status and invite button
children.characters: S: Lobby shows session status and invite button

children.name: S: Host sends invite link via share sheet
children.characters: S: Host sends invite link via share sheet

children.name: S: Friend opens invite link and joins as Participant
children.characters: S: Friend opens invite link and joins as Participant

children.name: S: Participants see lobby with song + readiness state
children.characters: S: Participants see lobby with song + readiness state

children.name: S: Host taps Start to begin karaoke session
children.characters: S: Host taps Start to begin karaoke session

children.name: S: During session, lyrics highlight and users can mute/unmute or leave
children.characters: S: During session, lyrics highlight and users can mute/unmute or leave

children.name: S: At end, users see a summary screen with share / replay / new song options
children.characters: S: At end, users see a summary screen with share / replay / new song options

children.name: EDGE CASES
EXIT: User joins session mid-song SYS: Sync lyrics to current playback position
children.characters:
EXIT: User joins session mid-song
SYS: Sync lyrics to current playback position

children.name: EXIT: Network interruption SYS: Attempt resync and show connection status
children.characters:
EXIT: Network interruption
SYS: Attempt resync and show connection status

children.name: EXIT: Host disconnects SYS: Pause session or transfer host
children.characters:
EXIT: Host disconnects
SYS: Pause session or transfer host

children.name: EXIT: Participant disconnects SYS: Allow quick rejoin
children.characters:
EXIT: Participant disconnects
SYS: Allow quick rejoin

children.name: EXIT: Invite link expired SYS: Show recovery message and exit
children.characters:
EXIT: Invite link expired
SYS: Show recovery message and exit

children.name: EXIT: Song unavailable in region SYS: Explain limitation and suggest alternatives
children.characters:
EXIT: Song unavailable in region
SYS: Explain limitation and suggest alternatives

children.name: EXIT: Invite link expired or invalid SYS: Show friendly recovery path
children.characters: EXIT: Invite link expired or invalid SYS: Show friendly recovery path

children.name: EXIT: Too many participants — SYS: Enforce a session cap and communicate why
children.characters:
EXIT: Too many participants — 
SYS: Enforce a session cap and communicate why

children.name: EXIT: User receives a call/audio interruption SYS: resume experience smoothly
children.characters:
EXIT: User receives a call/audio interruption
SYS: resume experience smoothly

children.name: EXIT: Abusive participant SYS: Allow report + leave + block actions
children.characters:
EXIT: Abusive participant 
SYS: Allow report + leave + block actions

children.name: ASSUMPTIONS
ASSUMPTION: Lyrics licensing allows karaoke-style display
children.characters: ASSUMPTION: Lyrics licensing allows karaoke-style display

children.name: ASSUMPTION: Small latency is acceptable in group sessions
children.characters: ASSUMPTION: Small latency is acceptable in group sessions

children.name: QUESTIONS
Q: Is audio recorded or purely live?
children.characters: Q: Is audio recorded or purely live?

children.name: Q: Is group playback strict-sync or best-effort?
children.characters: Q: Is group playback strict-sync or best-effort?

children.name: Q: Is a host required at all times?
children.characters: Q: Is a host required at all times?

children.name: Q: Do we support duets or rotating solos?
children.characters: Q: Do we support duets or rotating solos?

children.name: Q: Should sessions support video, or audio-only, or lyrics-only?
children.characters: Q: Should sessions support video, or audio-only, or lyrics-only?

children.name: Q: Do we support scoring in v1? If yes, what model and what feedback UI?
children.characters: Q: Do we support scoring in v1? If yes, what model and what feedback UI?

children.name: Q: Where does Karaoke live in the Spotify IA (song page, now playing, search)?
children.characters: Q: Where does Karaoke live in the Spotify IA (song page, now playing, search)?

children.name: Q: How do we handle explicit lyrics / content controls in group sessions?
children.characters: Q: How do we handle explicit lyrics / content controls in group sessions?

children.name: Q: What is the max participant count for a good experience?
children.characters: Q: What is the max participant count for a good experience?

children.name: Q: What is the max participant count for a good experience?
children.characters: Q: What is the max participant count for a good experience?

children.name: RISKS
RISK: Audio desync on low-end devices
children.characters: RISK: Audio desync on low-end devices

children.name: RISK: Abuse in group sessions
children.characters: RISK: Abuse in group sessions

children.name: RISK: Privacy concerns around microphone usage
children.characters: RISK: Privacy concerns around microphone usage

children.name: FLOW : SOLO KARAOKE

F: Solo Karaoke A: User START: User initiates Solo Karaoke from a song S: (S1) User opens a song detail page S: (S2) User taps “Karaoke” SYS: Evaluate Karaoke availability for the song D: Is Karaoke supported for this song? E: D1 -> S3 [label=Yes] E: D1 -> END_EXIT [label=No] S: (S3) User selects Solo Karaoke mode SYS: Request microphone permission (just-in-time) D: Is microphone permission granted? E: D2 -> S4 [label=Yes] E: D2 -> S5 [label=No] S: (S4) Start Solo Karaoke with live lyrics + mic input S: (S5) Start Solo Karaoke in lyrics-only mode END: Solo Karaoke session completed END: User exits Solo Karaoke early
children.characters:
F: Solo Karaoke
A: User

START: User initiates Solo Karaoke from a song

S: (S1) User opens a song detail page
S: (S2) User taps “Karaoke”
SYS: Evaluate Karaoke availability for the song

D: Is Karaoke supported for this song?
E: D1 -> S3 [label=Yes]
E: D1 -> END_EXIT [label=No]

S: (S3) User selects Solo Karaoke mode
SYS: Request microphone permission (just-in-time)

D: Is microphone permission granted?
E: D2 -> S4 [label=Yes]
E: D2 -> S5 [label=No]

S: (S4) Start Solo Karaoke with live lyrics + mic input
S: (S5) Start Solo Karaoke in lyrics-only mode

END: Solo Karaoke session completed
END: User exits Solo Karaoke early

children.name: FLOW: HOST WITH FRIENDS

F: Host With Friends A: Host START: Host initiates Karaoke with Friends from a song S: (H1) Host taps “Karaoke” S: (H2) Host selects “With Friends” SYS: Create karaoke session and lobby SYS: Request microphone permission (just-in-time) D: Is microphone permission granted? E: D3 -> H3 [label=Yes] E: D3 -> H4 [label=No] S: (H3) Host enters lobby with mic enabled S: (H4) Host enters lobby in lyrics-only mode S: (H5) Host shares invite link SYS: Generate invite link D: How does host invite friends? E: D4 -> H6 [label=Share Sheet] E: D4 -> H7 [label=Copy Link] S: (H8) Host waits in lobby SYS: Display joined participants and readiness state D: Are participants ready? E: D5 -> H9 [label=Yes] E: D5 -> H8 [label=No] S: (H9) Host starts Karaoke session SYS: Sync lyrics and playback for all participants END: Group Karaoke session completed END: Host leaves or ends session
children.characters:
F: Host With Friends
A: Host

START: Host initiates Karaoke with Friends from a song

S: (H1) Host taps “Karaoke”
S: (H2) Host selects “With Friends”
SYS: Create karaoke session and lobby

SYS: Request microphone permission (just-in-time)

D: Is microphone permission granted?
E: D3 -> H3 [label=Yes]
E: D3 -> H4 [label=No]

S: (H3) Host enters lobby with mic enabled
S: (H4) Host enters lobby in lyrics-only mode

S: (H5) Host shares invite link
SYS: Generate invite link

D: How does host invite friends?
E: D4 -> H6 [label=Share Sheet]
E: D4 -> H7 [label=Copy Link]

S: (H8) Host waits in lobby
SYS: Display joined participants and readiness state

D: Are participants ready?
E: D5 -> H9 [label=Yes]
E: D5 -> H8 [label=No]

S: (H9) Host starts Karaoke session
SYS: Sync lyrics and playback for all participants

END: Group Karaoke session completed
END: Host leaves or ends session

children.name: FLOW: JOIN VIA INVITE LINK

F: Join via Invite Link A: Guest START: Guest opens Karaoke invite link SYS: Validate invite link D: Is invite link valid? E: D6 -> G1 [label=Yes] E: D6 -> END_ERROR [label=No] S: (G1) Guest joins lobby SYS: Display song, participants, and session status SYS: Request microphone permission (just-in-time) D: Is microphone permission granted? E: D7 -> G2 [label=Yes] E: D7 -> G3 [label=No] S: (G2) Guest joins with mic enabled S: (G3) Guest joins in lyrics-only mode D: Has host started the session? E: D8 -> G4 [label=Yes] E: D8 -> G1 [label=No] S: (G4) Participate in karaoke session END: Guest leaves session END: Session ends
children.characters:
F: Join via Invite Link
A: Guest

START: Guest opens Karaoke invite link

SYS: Validate invite link

D: Is invite link valid?
E: D6 -> G1 [label=Yes]
E: D6 -> END_ERROR [label=No]

S: (G1) Guest joins lobby
SYS: Display song, participants, and session status

SYS: Request microphone permission (just-in-time)

D: Is microphone permission granted?
E: D7 -> G2 [label=Yes]
E: D7 -> G3 [label=No]

S: (G2) Guest joins with mic enabled
S: (G3) Guest joins in lyrics-only mode

D: Has host started the session?
E: D8 -> G4 [label=Yes]
E: D8 -> G1 [label=No]

S: (G4) Participate in karaoke session

END: Guest leaves session
END: Session ends

children.name: CONTEXT

CTX: Project = Spotify Karaoke CTX: Client = Spotify CTX: OutputSlug = spotify_karaoke CTX: Version = v1 CTX: Platform = Mobile (iOS, Android) CTX: Owner = Blue G: Enable users to sing along to songs solo or with friends G: Provide a fast, low-friction entry into karaoke from a song G: Preserve privacy and consent around microphone use G: Support imperfect networks with graceful degradation
children.characters:
CTX: Project = Spotify Karaoke
CTX: Client = Spotify
CTX: OutputSlug = spotify_karaoke
CTX: Version = v1
CTX: Platform = Mobile (iOS, Android)
CTX: Owner = Blue

G: Enable users to sing along to songs solo or with friends
G: Provide a fast, low-friction entry into karaoke from a song
G: Preserve privacy and consent around microphone use
G: Support imperfect networks with graceful degradation
